Module comp310_f21_hw08_comp310_f21_hw08_36
Package provided.discovery

Interface IDiscoveryServer

All Known Subinterfaces:
IRegisteredDiscoveryServer
public interface IDiscoveryServer
Discovery information for a particular category. An IDiscoveryServer enables one to find all end points registered on the remote discovery server machine in the same category.
Author:
Stephen Wong (c) 2018

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    disconnect()
    Disconnects this local discovery server from the remote discovery server machine.
    Iterable<IEndPointData>
    getAvailableEndPoints()
    Get all the currently registered end points with the same category as associated with this IDiscoveryServer.
    String
    getCategory()
    Get the category associated with this discovery server
    void
    watch​(Consumer<Iterable<IEndPointData>> endPtDisplayFn)
    Convenience method to automatically create a watch thread that will periodically get the currently available registered end points, calling the given Consumer function with the current end points when it does so.

  • Method Details

    • getAvailableEndPoints

      Iterable<IEndPointData> getAvailableEndPoints() throws RemoteException
      Get all the currently registered end points with the same category as associated with this IDiscoveryServer.
      Returns:
      A collection of the available end points.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in the event of communications errors with the registration server.

    • getCategory

      String getCategory()
      Get the category associated with this discovery server
      Returns:
      A category name

    • disconnect

      void disconnect()
      Disconnects this local discovery server from the remote discovery server machine. Stops any watch threads. This method should be called when the system exits.

    • watch

      void watch​(Consumer<Iterable<IEndPointData>> endPtDisplayFn)
      Convenience method to automatically create a watch thread that will periodically get the currently available registered end points, calling the given Consumer function with the current end points when it does so. Typically, the Consumer function would update the GUI with the currently available endpoints. The implementation of the supplied endPtDisplayFn is required to dispatch the call to the GUI event thread if necessary!
      Parameters:
      endPtDisplayFn - A Consumer function that will accept a Collection of IEndPointData
